title: Why is this a thing??
body:
"you haven't been friends for quite enough time yet" .... what???
and the best part "please choose another friend" 
how many people just give gifts at random and don't care who they give it to... if i want to give my friend a champ or skin i don't want to "please select another friend" i want to give that person a skin, It defeats the whole purpose if i just send it to 'another friend' instead...

You havent been friends for quite enough time yet
You cannot send a gift to a friend under lvl ...
you cannot send a friend a gift from an account under lvl ...
you can only send 3 gifts per day 
the list goes on

why is it so hard to give a friend a champ? ffs half of the promotional stuff requires you to send gifts anyway, why make it so hard?


It seems my friend is going to miss out on the free Gangplank skin now...


[EDIT]: its now the next morning, the last chance i have to get the skin to him before we go to uni, and it still doesn't work, this really isn't fair to him.

replies.body:
Why would your friend miss out on the free GP skin?
GP is currently free to play, so if he plays as GP he also gets GP for free alongside the skin.

Those restrictions are in place to prevent scamming and other problems.

"You can earn the free Captain Gangplank skin if you _own the champion_ and play a full matchmade game with him"
unfortunately you do need the champ still, otherwise riot would be giving a free champ and skin to everyone who plays the game :/

all this has done is rob my friend of gangplank and his new skin :(

People click on links.
Links ask for username and passwords.
People lose access to their account, their accounts buy stuff for other people, then the people get the account back and complain.

Reversing gifts is a MESS, trust me i've followed a few cases.
Better to prevent it.
Because stupid children complain when they go to gift trade and get rekt by the cunt who outsmarted them and got a free skin/champ

It's to avoid abuse from people who "hack" accounts. The delay helps people have time to notice unusual extra friends on their list so they can remove them before all their RP is spent gifting the hacker's account.

Of course, even if it does happen, there are steps that can be taken, but this acts as an extra deterrent.
